dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? Like, what even is happening?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? Like, what even is happening?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The market, um, it just opened lower again!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The market, um, it just opened lower again!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The market opened lower on Thursday, with more big banks reporting second quarter earnings, as investors grappled with the latest economic data showing the economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Like, Dow down, S&P down, Nasdaq down! All of it!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Like, Dow down, S&P down, Nasdaq down! All of it!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 0.6%, over 150 points, at Thursdays open, while the S&P 500 fell 0.6% and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite lost 0.9%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the jobless claims! Ugh, worse than expected. One point three million more?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the jobless claims! Ugh, worse than expected. One point three million more?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Stocks fell after jobless claims data came in slightly worse than expected, with 1.3 million more Americans filing for unemployment in the week ending July 11, according to the Labor Department.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but! Get this! Retail sales, they actually jumped! Seven point five percent!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but! Get this! Retail sales, they actually jumped! Seven point five percent!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Retail sales jumped by 7.5% in Junehigher than the 5.2% expected, but lower than last months record surge of 17.7%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I saw that! But like, not as much as last month's crazy seventeen percent, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I saw that! But like, not as much as last month's crazy seventeen percent, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Retail sales jumped by 7.5% in Junehigher than the 5.2% expected, but lower than last months record surge of 17.7%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, totally! But, um, that $300 shopping voucher thing? That might be it!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, totally! But, um, that three hundred dollars shopping voucher thing? That might be it!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yes, exactly! That makes sense! But then BofA stock fell? Even though they topped estimates?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yes, exactly! That makes sense! But then BofA stock fell? Even though they topped estimates?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bank of America topped estimates but its stock fell nearly 4% as the company set aside $4 billion for coronavirus-related losses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah! Because they set aside like, four billion for losses! It's wild!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah! Because they set aside like, four billion for losses! It's wild!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bank of America topped estimates but its stock fell nearly 4% as the company set aside $4 billion for coronavirus-related losses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wild! And then Morgan Stanley, they just crushed it with trading revenues! One hundred seventy percent up!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wild! And then Morgan Stanley, they just crushed it with trading revenues! One hundred seventy percent up!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Morgan Stanley shares rose by almost 1% after the bank easily beat analyst expectations thanks to surging trading revenueswith its revenue from fixed income traders increasing by 170% last quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable! But, um, Twitter? Down three percent after that insane hack!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable! But, um, Twitter? Down three percent after that insane hack!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of social media platform Twitter dropped more than 3% following a massive digital currency scam late on Wednesday: Hackers gained access to dozens of high-profile accounts, including Tesla CEO Elon Musk, former vice president Joe Biden and Microsoft cofounder Bill Gates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, the Elon Musk one! And Joe Biden! I couldn't believe it!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, the Elon Musk one! And Joe Biden! I couldn't believe it!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hackers gained access to dozens of high-profile accounts, including Tesla CEO Elon Musk, former vice president Joe Biden and Microsoft cofounder Bill Gates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know! And the FBI thinks it might be a foreign government!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And the F B I thinks it might be a foreign government!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's a lot, right? Especially after stocks were up earlier in the week with vaccine news.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a lot, right? Especially after stocks were up earlier in the week with vaccine news.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before Thursday, stocks had largely been moving higher this week. On Wednesday, stocks rallied on positive coronavirus vaccine news from Moderna and strong earnings results from Goldman Sachs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Moderna! But then, um, sixty-seven thousand new cases?

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Wednesday, stocks rallied on positive coronavirus vaccine news from Moderna... The U.S. reported a new daily record of more than 67,000 cases earlier this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's just, like, a roller coaster. Every single day.
